availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David L. Renaker (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. Lafferty Renaker in Harrison County, Kentucky, on July 30, 1842. Father of Catherine Renaker, James D. Renaker, John A. Renaker, Harrison Renaker, Andrew Renaker, Enoch Renaker, and Lizzie Renaker. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 170A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 427.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 560.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 118B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896.
"David Luther Renaker (1819-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial #20761358, accessed August 17, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/20761358.
